intro: Rhexia trifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved inkplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three leaflets. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rhexia trifolia is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
